credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Pope Receiving Visitor
medium: Pen and ink, graphite, brush and brown wash on paper
description: Interior, striped wall, framed picture hanging; a pope seated on a low pedestal under a rectabgular canopy, speaks to a kneeling visitor. The visitor is entreating him with some document, while two cardinals flanking the pope and two courtiers at some distance to the right look on. Pencil marks of intitial drawing, encluding sketched head of third courtier, remain throughout.
name: Drawing
